Description:
To implement corrective, planned preventive and predicted maintenance of Instruments and Automation PLC systems installed in the plant.
To analyze instruments / PLC’s operating problems and to find proper solution and to implement to avoid repeated breakdowns
To achieve 97% of machine utilization by minimizing breakdowns and to ensure KIMMCO quality assurance system requirement.
Routine checking of running equipments in the plant and monitoring PLC, supervisory and HMI system performance.
Perform expansion projects automation system & modification works as per the plans and schedules.
Trouble shooting of PLC related equipment breakdowns.
Perform modifications on Supervisory, HMI and on PLC systems as per process requirements.
Report log book with 100% accuracy for all observations, breakdowns and action taken with full details, work achieved or in progress and suggestions to improve the efficiency of the equipments
Maintain latest PLC, HMI and Supervisory software’s
Maintain minimum spare parts required for PLC and HMI systems.
Perform updating & familiarizing drawings according to the modifications made.
Attend all breakdown calls within an hour after working hours and during holidays.
Ensure safe working at all times with necessary guidelines.Skills
Skills:
Systems Thinking: Ability to understand complex systems and their interdependencies, considering both technical and non-technical aspects to develop holistic solutions.
Technical Expertise: In-depth knowledge of systems engineering principles, methodologies, and best practices. Familiarity with relevant technologies, tools, and frameworks.
Requirements Analysis: Proficiency in eliciting, documenting, analyzing, and managing system requirements. Skillful at translating user needs into technical specifications.
System Design: Capability to design and architect systems, considering functionality, performance, scalability, reliability, and security requirements.
Problem-Solving: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve technical challenges throughout the system development lifecycle.
Collaboration and Communication: Effective interpersonal and communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and clients. Ability to articulate technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
